question: Hello,My name is Jill, and I am 49 y.o.Long story short, car accident in 1999 which brought about three cervical surgeries in six years, culminating in damage to my vagus nerve.  I was placed in a halo, in the hosp for ten days after the vagus nerve damage.  In the next five days, I developed diabetes.  Within a month home, I developed gastroparesis.  Now, two months ago, they discovered a 2.8 cm tumor in the head of my pancreas, and a smaller one, 1.2 cm  (mass) cyst?  on my liver.I was told that I have cirrhosis by an Internist who was treating my hypoglycemia in Nov. of 09, and now these masses?  The first test was only an ultrasound, the second was a C/T.I am on SSI with only Medicare.  My primary is a P.A. at a Rural Health Clinic.  I have also fallen through the cracks.Also, I found out myself, that my pH is LOW.  Under 7 in fact.  I almost suspect metobolic acidosis, or diabetic acidosis, but I (again) digress!  Sorry.The pain I originally posted about, occured three weeks ago, and again 10 days ago.  The WORST vise-grip pain tight across my entire upper abdomen,, lower chect area.  It felt like both a heart attack, and six broken ribs!!!  Both times the pain did not subside for about four days.  Also, immediate white or yellow stools.I do not drink, haven't for 24 years, but I drank my share from 19-26.  Internist thinks the damage was lurking all these years.  Now, I wonder what is my greater problem , liver?  Pancreas? Or low pH?I am sorry this is all over the place.  Not to pull the sympathy card,..but, I lost my 23 y.o. daughter four years ago, and I do not think I am quite ready to go join her YET, as I just had a Grandson born last Thurs., and I have another one due in 4 weeks.  I'd appreciate any guidance, support, info, etc,...Thank you so much for reading this and for your precious TIME!Jillofark
